SEARCH
Package farm.core

Class Farm

Object
Farm
public class Farm extends Object
Top-level model class responsible for storing and making updates to the data and smaller model entities that make up the internal state of a farm.
Component of multiple stages. Complete the first stage and come back later
Component of Stage 1.
Component of Stage 2.
Component of Stage 3.

  • Constructor Details

    • Farm

      public Farm(Inventory inventory)
      Creates a new farm instance with an inventory supplied.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The inventory through which access to the farm's stock is provisioned.

    • Farm

      public Farm(Inventory inventory, AddressBook addressBook)
      Creates a new farm instance with an inventory and address book supplied.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The inventory through which access to the farm's stock is provisioned.
      addressBook - The address book storing the farm's customer records.

  • Method Details

    • getAllCustomers

      public List<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      Retrieves all customer records currently stored in the farm's address book.
      Returns:
      a list of all customers in the address book
      Ensures:
      the returned list is a shallow copy and cannot modify the original address book

    • getAllStock

      public List<Product> getAllStock()
      Retrieves all products currently stored in the farm's inventory.
      Returns:
      a list of all products in the inventory
      Ensures:
      the returned list is a shallow copy and cannot modify the original inventory

    • getTransactionManager

      public TransactionManager getTransactionManager()
      Retrieves the farm's transaction manager.
      Returns:
      the farm's transaction manager

    • getTransactionHistory

      public TransactionHistory getTransactionHistory()
      Retrieves the farm's transaction history.
      Returns:
      the farm's transaction history

    • saveCustomer

      public void saveCustomer(Customer customer) throws DuplicateCustomerException
      Saves the supplied customer in the farm's address book.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer to add to the address book.
      Throws:
      DuplicateCustomerException - if the address book already contains this customer
      See Also:
      • Customer.equals(Object)
      Component of Stage 1.

    • stockProduct

      public void stockProduct(Barcode barcode, Quality quality) throws InvalidStockRequestException

      Parameters:
      barcode - the product type to add to the inventory.
      quality - the quality of the product to add to hte inventory.
      Throws:
      InvalidStockRequestException - todo when does it throw? not super sure how these two interact
      Component of Stage 1.

    • stockProduct

      public void stockProduct(Barcode barcode, Quality quality, int quantity) throws InvalidStockRequestException
      Adds the specified number of a product type to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      barcode - the product type to add.
      quality - the quality of the product to add.
      quantity - the number of the product to add.
      Throws:
      InvalidStockRequestException - if an invalid quantity is provided, or if FancyInventory is not in use.
      Component of Stage 3.

    • startTransaction

      public void startTransaction(Transaction transaction) throws FailedTransactionException
      Sets the provided transaction as the current ongoing transaction.
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction to set as active.
      Throws:
      FailedTransactionException - if the customer associated with transaction does not exist in the addressbook.

    • addToCart

      public int addToCart(Barcode barcode) throws FailedTransactionException
      Adds one of the given product type to the customer's shopping cart.
      Parameters:
      barcode - the product type to add.
      Returns:
      the number of products successully added to the cart. i.e. if none of the product exists in the inventory, this will return 0.
      Throws:
      FailedTransactionException - if no ongoing transaction can be found. TODO @ali same here, not sure how you want to document the overloaded stuff when its different stages

    • addToCart

      public int addToCart(Barcode barcode, int quantity) throws FailedTransactionException
      Adds the specified number of the given product type to the customer's shopping cart. If inventory does not contain enough stock, adds as many products as possible to the cart. Note: in stages 1 and 2, this will always return 0 or 1.
      Parameters:
      barcode - the product type to add.
      quantity - the number of the product to add.
      Returns:
      the number of the product successfully added to the cart.
      Throws:
      FailedTransactionException - if no ongoing transaction can be found, negative quantity entered, or multiple items added to a basic inventory.
      Component of Stage 3.

    • checkout

      public boolean checkout() throws FailedTransactionException
      Closes the ongoing transaction. If items are purchased within the transaction, stores the transaction in transaction history. Note: checking out an empty cart is more akin to putting the cart back in the store, hence we do not want this recorded in the transaction history.
      Returns:
      true iff the finalised transaction contained products.
      Throws:
      FailedTransactionException - if transaction cannot be closed.

    • getLastReceipt

      public String getLastReceipt()
      Retrieves the string representation of the most recent transaction.
      Returns:
      the string representation (receipt) of the most recent transaction.

    • getCustomer

      public Customer getCustomer(String name, int phoneNumber) throws CustomerNotFoundException
      Retrieves a customer from the address book.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the customer.
      phoneNumber - the phone number of the customer.
      Returns:
      the customer instance matching the name and phone number.
      Throws:
      CustomerNotFoundException - if the customer does not exist in the address book.
